wikipedia_page.main:
Brigadier-General Hugh Frederick Bateman-Champain, CMG (6 April 1869 – 7 October 1933) was an Indian Army officer and cricketer.
Bateman-Champain was a right-handed batsman who played 11 first-class matches for Gloucestershire, with his debut for the county coming in 1888 against Yorkshire and his final first-class match for the county coming against Surrey in 1902.  He also represented the Marylebone Cricket Club in a single first-class match in 1902 against Kent.Bateman-Champain died at Ascot, Berkshire on 7 October 1933.
